workflow.name: Discover GitHub developers with Hunter.io email lookup & Google Sheets CRM sync
workflow.description:
This workflow automatically discovers developers on GitHub, enriches their data with email addresses, removes duplicates, and saves everything into a structured Google Sheets CRM. No manual searching, copying, or data cleaning required.

It‚Äôs perfect for recruiter teams, SaaS founders, agencies, and outbound marketers who need fresh developer leads every day without spending hours on GitHub.

## How It Works

This automation is divided into 3 clear stages:

1. Find Developers on GitHub. The workflow runs on a schedule (daily/hourly).

2. Enrich Developer Data with Emails. The workflow checks if a developer already has an email. If not, it automatically uses Hunter.io to find a professional email address.

3. Remove Duplicates & Save to Google Sheets

## What You Get

- Automatic developer sourcing

- Email enrichment using Hunter.io

- Built-in duplicate detection

- Clean, enriched data you can use instantly for outreach

## What You Need

- GitHub API 

- Hunter.io API key 

- Google Sheets connection

- n8n (self-hosted or cloud)

nodes.name: Search GitHub Users
nodes.notes: Replace YOUR_GITHUB_TOKEN with your personal access token

parameters.content: ## 3. Remove Duplicates and Save To CRM Database

## GitHub Developer Scraper With Email Lookup and Lead Database Sync

## How it works
1. Schedule Trigger: start trigger at a certain interval
2. Define developer searches Code nodes: find a developer at a certain location and demographic
3. Search GitHub users: Run code through GitHub to collect details
4. Parse users: Analyze users' data
5. Get users' details: Return users' data
6. Extract developer data: clean and organize the returned users' data
7. Need enrichment: check if no email
8. Hunter.io email lookup: find and verify user email
9. Update with email: organize data
10. Check for duplicate data, remove duplicates, organize for the database and store to Google Sheets accordingly. 

## Setup
* Schedule trigger to start
* Get the GitHub API and insert it in the "Search GitHub users" HTTP request node. Also, insert it in the "Get user details" HTTP request node
* Get Hunter.io API and insert it in the Hunter.io Email Lookup HTTP request
* Use "Get the template" Google sheet

## Get the template sheet: https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1HyoSj2HncMgap96eNxkzLEMxt1DjO6J4uOj8CHrYkFc/edit?usp=sharing

user.name: Gilbert Onyebuchi
user.bio: Automation builder dedicated to creating powerful, efficient, and scalable workflow solutions. I transform manual processes into seamless automations that save time, reduce errors, and unlock growth for teams and solo operators alike. With strong experience in n8n. I design systems that handle lead management, data enrichment, outreach, marketing and internal operations. My work focuses on results, reliability, and simplicity so you can achieve more with less effort.

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.
